Description: Egyptian terracotta mould-made figure plaque of seated individual behind three Greek style amphorae. Base frament, broken at neck. Red brown fabric with black core. Abundant fine silver mica, quartz, black and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Figure plaque of Late Period in both style and technique, probably depicting imported Greek amphorae. The amphorae have straight necks and globular or triangular bodies. See also NA367 in Cambridge also from Naukratis. Pencil mark '95' on back is unclear and may represent the find location.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.138) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 97, no. 357)
